title: Workshop on Designing Early Childhood Digital Game-Based Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Theoretical Foundations of Basic Mathematics Education and Experience with Digital Media Utilization
context.additional_context: Strengthening the capacity to design mathematics games for young children in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Design three learning objectives for an early childhood mathematics game based on the Dick & Carey model.

Learners can apply agile R&D methodologies to develop one digital game prototype (2D platformer genre) in teams of three within five days, implement 70% or more of functional requirements, incorporate five or more user test feedbacks, and submit a final report.
Implement two assessment tools for evaluating early childhood learning effectiveness through VR simulations.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
